title: Swanwick Lakes Walking Route

images.title: Hugh Venables / Swanwick Reserve Centre
images.caption: Swanwick Reserve Centre. At this educational facility children can learn about the natural environment.

images.title: Hugh Venables / Clay Pit
images.caption: Clay Pit. Old clay pit associated with brick making.

images.title: Peter Facey / Gate offering access to Bens Lake, Swanwick
images.caption: Gate offering access to Bens Lake. A peculiar stile or gate design I haven't seen before. The counter-weight is sufficiently light so that the bars shut into their horizontal position under their own weight. To photograph this I had to hold the thing open and then snap it quickly as it fell shut. Of course, the design leaves a rather large, and certainly not stock-proof hole under the counter-weight.

images.title: Early spring at Swanwick Lakes (2) by Basher Eyre, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Ben's Lake

description: This walk visits the Swanwick Lakes Nature Reserve in the Hampshire village of Swanwick. Here you can enjoy a series of footpaths taking you around the site's woodland, meadows and lakes which are made from the former clay pits. There's lots of wildlife to see with birds including marsh tits and woodpeckers. Wildflowers in the summer include orchids and knapweed attracting lots of butterflies such as marbled white, meadow brown and gatekeeper. To continue your walking in the area head north over the River Hamble to visit Manor Farm and Country Park . There's some fine cycling and walking trails with 600 year old historic buildings including the 13th century St Bartholomew's church.
